title: Want To Buy:  Beware The Craigslist Troll!
postcontent: Beware of the troll who has moved from Craigslist to Armslist. He is using multiple e-mail addresses, but it is the same scam every time. I have had him contact me about seven of my ads so far. Every time I post an ad, I get a response from him that says he is VERY interested in buying my item, and to please respond. When I respond, he always says for me to consider it sold, and that he will be sending me the funds via cashier's check if that is okay. DON'T FALL FOR IT! First, any and all transactions should be done in cash, and face-to-face, unless you want to go through an FFL dealer and ship a gun. Further, it is an age-old scam, where they send you a very legitimate-looking cashier's check (usually a Postal Money Order, but it varies) and the counterfeit is so good, even most bankers will not know it is fake. Very often, they will send you a check for more than the agreed upon price, and ask that you just give a small cash refund to the party who shows up to receive the item. (Car, gun, lawnmower, whatever you are selling). It is a very slick operation, and you usually can deposit the check or money order and your account will be credited with the money until it gets back to the point of origin, at which time, a few days later, your bank will inform you that the check or money order is counterfeit, and you do not have the funds in your account. So then, you are out the item you sold, and any cash you might have been dumb enough to give the person who picked it up. IT IS A SCAM! DO NOT FALL FOR IT!

Very often, they will send you a check for more than the agreed upon price, and ask that you just give a small cash refund to the party who shows up to receive the item. (Car, gun, lawnmower, whatever you are selling). It is a very slick operation, and you usually can deposit the check or money order and your account will be credited with the money until it gets back to the point of origin, at which time, a few days later, your bank will inform you that the check or money order is counterfeit, and you do not have the funds in your account. title: For Sale:  You should read this!
postcontent: Beware of the troll who has moved from Craigslist to Armslist. He is using multiple e-mail addresses, but it is the same scam every time. I have had him contact me about seven of my ads so far. Every time I post an ad, I get a response from him that says he is VERY interested in buying my item, and to please respond. When I respond, he always says for me to consider it sold, and that he will be sending me the funds via cashier's check if that is okay. DON'T FALL FOR IT! First, any and all transactions should be done in cash, and face-to-face, unless you want to go through an FFL dealer and ship a gun. Further, it is an age-old scam, where they send you a very legitimate-looking cashier's check (usually a Postal Money Order, but it varies) and the counterfeit is so good, even most bankers will not know it is fake. Very often, they will send you a check for more than the agreed upon price, and ask that you just give a small cash refund to the party who shows up to receive the item. (Car, gun, lawnmower, whatever you are selling). It is a very slick operation, and you usually can deposit the check or money order and your account will be credited with the money until it gets back to the point of origin, at which time, a few days later, your bank will inform you that the check or money order is counterfeit, and you do not have the funds in your account. So then, you are out the item you sold, and any cash you might have been dumb enough to give the person who picked it up. IT IS A SCAM! DO NOT FALL FOR IT!
